aws-athena:position-deletes:v3.notes: Athena does not support Iceberg V3

aws-athena:equality-deletes:v3.notes: Athena does not support Iceberg V3

aws-athena:merge-on-read:v2.notes: Supports merge-on-read for both position and equality deletes

aws-athena:merge-on-read:v3.notes: Athena does not support Iceberg V3

aws-athena:copy-on-write:v2.notes: Copy-on-write is the default write mode, but any MERGE or DELETE operation uses merge-on-read regardless of table properties
caveats: MERGE and DELETE always use merge-on-read
Table write.delete.mode and write.update.mode properties are ignored for these operations

aws-athena:copy-on-write:v3.notes: Athena does not support Iceberg V3

aws-athena:schema-evolution:v2.notes: Add, drop, and rename columns supported

aws-athena:schema-evolution:v3.notes: Athena does not support Iceberg V3

aws-athena:column-default-values:v2.notes: Column default values are a V3 feature

aws-athena:column-default-values:v3.notes: Athena does not support Iceberg V3

aws-athena:nanosecond-timestamps:v2.notes: Nanosecond timestamps are a V3 feature

aws-athena:nanosecond-timestamps:v3.notes: Athena does not support Iceberg V3

aws-athena:hidden-partitioning:v2.notes: Supports identity, bucket, truncate, year, month, day, hour transforms

aws-athena:hidden-partitioning:v3.notes: Athena does not support Iceberg V3

aws-athena:partition-evolution:v3.notes: Athena does not support Iceberg V3

aws-athena:multi-arg-transforms:v2.notes: Multi-argument transforms are a V3 feature

aws-athena:multi-arg-transforms:v3.notes: Athena does not support Iceberg V3

aws-athena:time-travel:v2.notes: Query by snapshot ID or timestamp

aws-athena:time-travel:v3.notes: Athena does not support Iceberg V3

aws-athena:table-maintenance:v2.notes: Supports OPTIMIZE (REWRITE DATA compaction with BIN_PACK), VACUUM (snapshot expiry and orphan file removal), Iceberg table statistics for cost-based optimization, and Parquet column indexing; no rewrite_manifests procedure
caveats: No rewrite_manifests procedure
OPTIMIZE limited to BIN_PACK strategy
VACUUM combines snapshot expiry and orphan file removal

aws-athena:table-maintenance:v3.notes: Athena does not support Iceberg V3

aws-athena:branching-tagging:v2.notes: Athena can read tags via the $ref metadata table but cannot create or manage branches and tags
caveats: Read-only access to tags via $ref metadata table
Cannot create or manage branches and tags

aws-athena:branching-tagging:v3.notes: Athena does not support Iceberg V3

aws-athena:read-support:v2.notes: Full read support via Athena engine v3

aws-athena:read-support:v3.notes: Athena does not support Iceberg V3

aws-athena:write-insert:v3.notes: Athena does not support Iceberg V3

aws-athena:write-merge-update-delete:v2.notes: MERGE, UPDATE, DELETE supported via Athena engine v3

aws-athena:write-merge-update-delete:v3.notes: Athena does not support Iceberg V3

aws-athena:catalog-integration:v2.notes: Integrated with AWS Glue Data Catalog

aws-athena:catalog-integration:v3.notes: Athena does not support Iceberg V3

aws-athena:hive-metastore:v2.notes: Athena uses AWS Glue Catalog exclusively

aws-athena:hive-metastore:v3.notes: Athena does not support Iceberg V3

aws-athena:aws-glue-catalog:v2.notes: Native integration with AWS Glue Data Catalog

aws-athena:aws-glue-catalog:v3.notes: Athena does not support Iceberg V3

aws-athena:rest-catalog:v2.notes: Athena does not support REST Catalog directly

aws-athena:rest-catalog:v3.notes: Athena does not support Iceberg V3

aws-athena:nessie:v2.notes: Athena does not support Nessie catalog

aws-athena:nessie:v3.notes: Athena does not support Iceberg V3

aws-athena:polaris:v2.notes: Athena does not support Polaris catalog

aws-athena:polaris:v3.notes: Athena does not support Iceberg V3

aws-athena:unity-catalog:v2.notes: Athena does not support Unity Catalog

aws-athena:unity-catalog:v3.notes: Athena does not support Iceberg V3

aws-athena:hadoop-catalog:v2.notes: Athena does not support Hadoop catalog

aws-athena:hadoop-catalog:v3.notes: Athena does not support Iceberg V3

aws-athena:jdbc-catalog:v2.notes: Athena does not support JDBC catalog

aws-athena:jdbc-catalog:v3.notes: Athena does not support Iceberg V3

aws-firehose:position-deletes:v2.notes: Firehose is a delivery service; it writes to Iceberg tables but does not read or process delete files

aws-firehose:position-deletes:v3.notes: Firehose does not support Iceberg V3

aws-firehose:equality-deletes:v2.notes: Firehose does not support delete operations

aws-firehose:equality-deletes:v3.notes: Firehose does not support Iceberg V3

aws-firehose:merge-on-read:v2.notes: Firehose will use equality deletes for updates and deletes

aws-firehose:merge-on-read:v3.notes: Firehose does not support Iceberg V3

aws-firehose:copy-on-write:v2.notes: Firehose append-only mode effectively uses copy-on-write semantics (new data files, no delete files)
caveats: Only append mode; no UPDATE/DELETE support

aws-firehose:copy-on-write:v3.notes: Firehose does not support Iceberg V3

aws-firehose:schema-evolution:v2.notes: Firehose can deliver to tables with evolved schemas but cannot perform schema changes itself
caveats: Schema changes must be made externally

aws-firehose:schema-evolution:v3.notes: Firehose does not support Iceberg V3

aws-firehose:column-default-values:v2.notes: Column default values are a V3 feature

aws-firehose:column-default-values:v3.notes: Firehose does not support Iceberg V3

aws-firehose:nanosecond-timestamps:v2.notes: Nanosecond timestamps are a V3 feature

aws-firehose:nanosecond-timestamps:v3.notes: Firehose does not support Iceberg V3

aws-firehose:hidden-partitioning:v2.notes: Firehose supports writing to hidden-partitioned Iceberg tables using dynamic partitioning

aws-firehose:hidden-partitioning:v3.notes: Firehose does not support Iceberg V3

aws-firehose:partition-evolution:v3.notes: Firehose does not support Iceberg V3

aws-firehose:multi-arg-transforms:v2.notes: Multi-argument transforms are a V3 feature

aws-firehose:multi-arg-transforms:v3.notes: Firehose does not support Iceberg V3

aws-firehose:time-travel:v2.notes: Firehose is a write-only delivery service; no read or query capabilities

aws-firehose:time-travel:v3.notes: Firehose does not support Iceberg V3

aws-firehose:table-maintenance:v2.notes: Firehose does not perform table maintenance operations

aws-firehose:table-maintenance:v3.notes: Firehose does not support Iceberg V3

aws-firehose:branching-tagging:v2.notes: Firehose does not support branching and tagging

aws-firehose:branching-tagging:v3.notes: Firehose does not support Iceberg V3

aws-firehose:read-support:v2.notes: Firehose is a write-only delivery service

aws-firehose:read-support:v3.notes: Firehose does not support Iceberg V3

aws-firehose:write-insert:v2.notes: Firehose delivers streaming data as INSERT/append operations to Iceberg tables on S3

aws-firehose:write-insert:v3.notes: Firehose does not support Iceberg V3

aws-firehose:write-merge-update-delete:v.notes: Firehose supports MERGE, UPDATE, and DELETE operations using JSON query definitions to specify the operation type
caveats: Requires JSON query to define the operation
When you specify the operation as update or delete, you must either specify unique keys for the destination table when you set up your Firehose stream, or set identifier-field-ids in Iceberg

aws-firehose:write-merge-update-delete:v.notes: Firehose does not support Iceberg V3

aws-firehose:catalog-integration:v2.notes: Firehose integrates with AWS Glue Data Catalog for Iceberg table metadata

aws-firehose:catalog-integration:v3.notes: Firehose does not support Iceberg V3

aws-firehose:hive-metastore:v2.notes: Firehose uses AWS Glue Catalog exclusively for Iceberg

aws-firehose:hive-metastore:v3.notes: Firehose does not support Iceberg V3

aws-firehose:aws-glue-catalog:v2.notes: Firehose uses AWS Glue Data Catalog for Iceberg table delivery

aws-firehose:aws-glue-catalog:v3.notes: Firehose does not support Iceberg V3

aws-firehose:rest-catalog:v2.notes: Firehose does not support REST Catalog

aws-firehose:rest-catalog:v3.notes: Firehose does not support Iceberg V3

aws-firehose:nessie:v2.notes: Firehose does not support Nessie catalog

aws-firehose:nessie:v3.notes: Firehose does not support Iceberg V3

aws-firehose:polaris:v2.notes: Firehose does not support Polaris catalog

aws-firehose:polaris:v3.notes: Firehose does not support Iceberg V3

aws-firehose:unity-catalog:v2.notes: Firehose does not support Unity Catalog

aws-firehose:unity-catalog:v3.notes: Firehose does not support Iceberg V3

aws-firehose:hadoop-catalog:v2.notes: Firehose does not support Hadoop catalog

aws-firehose:hadoop-catalog:v3.notes: Firehose does not support Iceberg V3

aws-firehose:jdbc-catalog:v2.notes: Firehose does not support JDBC catalog

aws-firehose:jdbc-catalog:v3.notes: Firehose does not support Iceberg V3

aws-managed-flink:position-deletes:v2.notes: Supported via user-provided iceberg-flink-runtime JAR on Amazon Managed Flink (Flink 1.19/1.20 with Iceberg 1.6.0+)
caveats: Iceberg is not a pre-built connector; users must bundle iceberg-flink-runtime JAR in their application

aws-managed-flink:position-deletes:v3.notes: V3 support available when bundling iceberg-flink-runtime 1.7.0+ (which supports format-version 3). Managed Flink itself is not listed in AWS's V3 support matrix since it runs user-provided JARs
caveats: Iceberg is not a pre-built connector; users must bundle iceberg-flink-runtime JAR (1.7.0+) for V3 support
Not listed in AWS V3 support matrix — V3 depends entirely on the Iceberg library version bundled by the user

aws-managed-flink:equality-deletes:v2.notes: Supported via UPSERT mode with equality deletes in the Flink Iceberg connector; requires V2 format and primary key
caveats: Iceberg is not a pre-built connector; users must bundle iceberg-flink-runtime JAR

aws-managed-flink:equality-deletes:v3.notes: Equality deletes supported with V3 format when bundling iceberg-flink-runtime 1.7.0+
caveats: Iceberg is not a pre-built connector; users must bundle iceberg-flink-runtime JAR (1.7.0+) for V3 support

aws-managed-flink:merge-on-read:v2.notes: Merge-on-read supported via streaming upsert mode using equality deletes in the Flink Iceberg connector
caveats: Iceberg is not a pre-built connector; users must bundle iceberg-flink-runtime JAR

aws-managed-flink:merge-on-read:v3.notes: Merge-on-read supported with V3 format including deletion vectors when bundling iceberg-flink-runtime 1.7.0+
caveats: Iceberg is not a pre-built connector; users must bundle iceberg-flink-runtime JAR (1.7.0+) for V3 support

aws-managed-flink:copy-on-write:v2.notes: Copy-on-write supported via INSERT INTO and INSERT OVERWRITE in the Flink Iceberg connector
caveats: Iceberg is not a pre-built connector; users must bundle iceberg-flink-runtime JAR

aws-managed-flink:copy-on-write:v3.notes: Copy-on-write supported with V3 format when bundling iceberg-flink-runtime 1.7.0+
caveats: Iceberg is not a pre-built connector; users must bundle iceberg-flink-runtime JAR (1.7.0+) for V3 support

aws-managed-flink:schema-evolution:v2.notes: Flink can read tables with evolved schemas, but ALTER TABLE only supports changing table properties — column additions, renames, drops, reordering, and partition changes are not supported via Flink SQL DDL
caveats: ALTER TABLE only supports changing table properties; column and partition schema changes not supported via Flink SQL
Iceberg is not a pre-built connector; users must bundle iceberg-flink-runtime JAR

aws-managed-flink:schema-evolution:v3.notes: Flink can read V3 tables with evolved schemas, but ALTER TABLE only supports changing table properties — column and partition changes not supported via Flink SQL DDL
caveats: ALTER TABLE only supports changing table properties; column and partition schema changes not supported via Flink SQL
Iceberg is not a pre-built connector; users must bundle iceberg-flink-runtime JAR (1.7.0+) for V3 support

aws-managed-flink:column-default-values:.notes: Column default values are a V3 feature
Column default values are a V3 feature; Flink Iceberg integration has not explicitly documented support
caveats: No explicit documentation for Flink support of V3 column default values

aws-managed-flink:nanosecond-timestamps:.notes: Nanosecond timestamps are a V3 feature
Nanosecond timestamps are a V3 feature; Flink Iceberg integration has not explicitly documented support
caveats: No explicit documentation for Flink support of V3 nanosecond timestamps

aws-managed-flink:hidden-partitioning:v2.notes: Flink can read and write to tables with hidden partitions created by other engines, but Flink DDL PARTITION BY does not support transform functions (e.g., days(), hours(), bucket())
caveats: Flink DDL PARTITION BY does not support transform functions; use Spark or another engine to create hidden-partitioned tables
Iceberg is not a pre-built connector; users must bundle iceberg-flink-runtime JAR

aws-managed-flink:hidden-partitioning:v3.notes: Flink can read and write to V3 tables with hidden partitions created by other engines, but Flink DDL does not support creating tables with transform-based partitioning
caveats: Flink DDL PARTITION BY does not support transform functions; use Spark or another engine to create hidden-partitioned tables
Iceberg is not a pre-built connector; users must bundle iceberg-flink-runtime JAR (1.7.0+) for V3 support

aws-managed-flink:partition-evolution:v2.notes: Partition evolution supported via the Dynamic Sink (Sink V2-based implementation)
caveats: Requires Dynamic Sink (Sink V2-based implementation)

aws-managed-flink:partition-evolution:v3.notes: Partition evolution supported via the Dynamic Sink (Sink V2-based implementation) for V3 tables
caveats: Requires Dynamic Sink (Sink V2-based implementation)

aws-managed-flink:multi-arg-transforms:v.notes: Multi-argument transforms are a V3 feature
Multi-argument transforms are a V3 feature; Flink Iceberg integration has not explicitly documented support
caveats: No explicit documentation for Flink support of V3 multi-argument transforms

aws-managed-flink:time-travel:v2.notes: Flink supports time travel via snapshot-id and as-of-timestamp read options in batch mode, plus branch and tag reads via SQL hints
caveats: Uses SQL hint syntax (/*+ OPTIONS('snapshot-id'='...') */) rather than native SQL time travel syntax

aws-managed-flink:time-travel:v3.notes: Time travel supported for V3 tables via snapshot-id, as-of-timestamp, branch, and tag read options when bundling iceberg-flink-runtime 1.7.0+
caveats: Uses SQL hint syntax (/*+ OPTIONS('snapshot-id'='...') */) rather than native SQL time travel syntax
Iceberg is not a pre-built connector; users must bundle iceberg-flink-runtime JAR (1.7.0+) for V3 support

aws-managed-flink:table-maintenance:v2.notes: Flink supports the rewrite files action (compaction) but does not support expire_snapshots, remove_orphan_files, or rewrite_manifests — use Spark for full maintenance
caveats: Only rewrite files action available; expire_snapshots, remove_orphan_files, rewrite_manifests not supported
Iceberg is not a pre-built connector; users must bundle iceberg-flink-runtime JAR

aws-managed-flink:table-maintenance:v3.notes: Flink supports the rewrite files action (compaction) for V3 tables but does not support expire_snapshots, remove_orphan_files, or rewrite_manifests
caveats: Only rewrite files action available; expire_snapshots, remove_orphan_files, rewrite_manifests not supported
Iceberg is not a pre-built connector; users must bundle iceberg-flink-runtime JAR (1.7.0+) for V3 support

aws-managed-flink:branching-tagging:v2.notes: Flink can write to branches via FlinkSink.toBranch() and read from branches/tags via SQL hints. Cannot create or manage branches/tags via DDL
caveats: Cannot create or manage branches/tags; read and write to existing branches/tags only

aws-managed-flink:branching-tagging:v3.notes: Flink can write to branches and read from branches/tags for V3 tables when bundling iceberg-flink-runtime 1.7.0+. Cannot create or manage branches/tags via DDL
caveats: Cannot create or manage branches/tags; read and write to existing branches/tags only
Iceberg is not a pre-built connector; users must bundle iceberg-flink-runtime JAR (1.7.0+) for V3 support

aws-managed-flink:read-support:v2.notes: Full read support in both batch and streaming modes, including incremental reads from snapshots via Flink Iceberg connector
caveats: Iceberg is not a pre-built connector; users must bundle iceberg-flink-runtime JAR

aws-managed-flink:read-support:v3.notes: Full read support for V3 tables in both batch and streaming modes when bundling iceberg-flink-runtime 1.7.0+
caveats: Iceberg is not a pre-built connector; users must bundle iceberg-flink-runtime JAR (1.7.0+) for V3 support

aws-managed-flink:write-insert:v2.notes: INSERT INTO supported in both batch and streaming modes; INSERT OVERWRITE supported in batch mode only
caveats: INSERT OVERWRITE is not supported in streaming mode
Iceberg is not a pre-built connector; users must bundle iceberg-flink-runtime JAR

aws-managed-flink:write-insert:v3.notes: INSERT INTO and INSERT OVERWRITE supported with V3 format when bundling iceberg-flink-runtime 1.7.0+; INSERT OVERWRITE is batch-only
caveats: INSERT OVERWRITE is not supported in streaming mode
Iceberg is not a pre-built connector; users must bundle iceberg-flink-runtime JAR (1.7.0+) for V3 support

aws-managed-flink:write-merge-update-del.notes: Flink supports UPSERT mode via equality deletes (requires V2 format and primary key) but does not support SQL MERGE INTO, UPDATE, or DELETE statements
caveats: No SQL MERGE INTO, UPDATE, or DELETE syntax; uses streaming upsert mode with equality deletes instead
UPSERT requires V2+ format and a PRIMARY KEY defined on the table

aws-managed-flink:write-merge-update-del.notes: Flink supports UPSERT mode via equality deletes for V3 tables but does not support SQL MERGE INTO, UPDATE, or DELETE statements
caveats: No SQL MERGE INTO, UPDATE, or DELETE syntax; uses streaming upsert mode with equality deletes instead
UPSERT requires a PRIMARY KEY defined on the table
Iceberg is not a pre-built connector; users must bundle iceberg-flink-runtime JAR (1.7.0+) for V3 support

aws-managed-flink:catalog-integration:v2.notes: Supports built-in Iceberg catalog types (hive, hadoop, rest, glue, jdbc, nessie) plus custom catalog implementations via catalog-impl
caveats: Iceberg is not a pre-built connector; users must bundle iceberg-flink-runtime JAR and iceberg-aws-bundle for AWS integrations

aws-managed-flink:catalog-integration:v3.notes: Supports built-in Iceberg catalog types for V3 tables when bundling iceberg-flink-runtime 1.7.0+
caveats: Iceberg is not a pre-built connector; users must bundle iceberg-flink-runtime JAR (1.7.0+) and iceberg-aws-bundle for AWS integrations

aws-managed-flink:hive-metastore:v2.notes: Hive Metastore supported via Iceberg's built-in catalog-type='hive'; requires bundling Hive connector JARs alongside iceberg-flink-runtime
caveats: Requires bundling Hive connector JARs (e.g., flink-sql-connector-hive) in addition to iceberg-flink-runtime

aws-managed-flink:hive-metastore:v3.notes: Hive Metastore supported for V3 tables via Iceberg's built-in catalog-type='hive' when bundling iceberg-flink-runtime 1.7.0+
caveats: Requires bundling Hive connector JARs and iceberg-flink-runtime 1.7.0+ for V3 support

aws-managed-flink:aws-glue-catalog:v2.notes: AWS Glue Data Catalog supported via Iceberg's built-in catalog-type='glue'; requires bundling iceberg-aws-bundle alongside iceberg-flink-runtime
caveats: Requires bundling iceberg-aws-bundle JAR for Glue and S3 integration

aws-managed-flink:aws-glue-catalog:v3.notes: AWS Glue Data Catalog supported for V3 tables when bundling iceberg-flink-runtime 1.7.0+ and iceberg-aws-bundle
caveats: Requires bundling iceberg-aws-bundle JAR for Glue and S3 integration
Requires iceberg-flink-runtime 1.7.0+ for V3 support

aws-managed-flink:rest-catalog:v2.notes: REST Catalog supported via Iceberg's built-in catalog-type='rest'
caveats: Iceberg is not a pre-built connector; users must bundle iceberg-flink-runtime JAR

aws-managed-flink:rest-catalog:v3.notes: REST Catalog supported for V3 tables when bundling iceberg-flink-runtime 1.7.0+
caveats: Iceberg is not a pre-built connector; users must bundle iceberg-flink-runtime JAR (1.7.0+) for V3 support

aws-managed-flink:nessie:v2.notes: Nessie supported via Iceberg's built-in catalog-type='nessie'
caveats: Requires Nessie endpoint configuration and bundling iceberg-flink-runtime JAR

aws-managed-flink:nessie:v3.notes: Nessie supported for V3 tables when bundling iceberg-flink-runtime 1.7.0+
caveats: Requires Nessie endpoint configuration and iceberg-flink-runtime 1.7.0+ for V3 support

aws-managed-flink:polaris:v2.notes: Polaris supported via REST Catalog API (catalog-type='rest') with Polaris endpoint
caveats: Requires REST Catalog endpoint configuration pointing to Polaris

aws-managed-flink:polaris:v3.notes: Polaris supported via REST Catalog API for V3 tables when bundling iceberg-flink-runtime 1.7.0+
caveats: Requires REST Catalog endpoint configuration pointing to Polaris
Requires iceberg-flink-runtime 1.7.0+ for V3 support

aws-managed-flink:unity-catalog:v2.notes: Can connect to Unity Catalog via REST Catalog API (catalog-type='rest') but not a natural fit for the AWS ecosystem
caveats: Requires REST Catalog endpoint configuration pointing to Unity Catalog
Not a typical integration for AWS Managed Flink

aws-managed-flink:unity-catalog:v3.notes: Can connect to Unity Catalog via REST Catalog API for V3 tables but not a natural fit for the AWS ecosystem
caveats: Requires REST Catalog endpoint configuration pointing to Unity Catalog
Not a typical integration for AWS Managed Flink

aws-managed-flink:hadoop-catalog:v2.notes: Hadoop catalog supported via Iceberg's built-in catalog-type='hadoop'; ships with Hadoop jars by default in iceberg-flink-runtime

aws-managed-flink:hadoop-catalog:v3.notes: Hadoop catalog supported for V3 tables when bundling iceberg-flink-runtime 1.7.0+
caveats: Requires iceberg-flink-runtime 1.7.0+ for V3 support

aws-managed-flink:jdbc-catalog:v2.notes: JDBC catalog supported via Iceberg's built-in catalog-type='jdbc'; requires bundling JDBC driver JAR
caveats: Requires bundling JDBC driver JAR and endpoint configuration

aws-managed-flink:jdbc-catalog:v3.notes: JDBC catalog supported for V3 tables when bundling iceberg-flink-runtime 1.7.0+ and JDBC driver
caveats: Requires bundling JDBC driver JAR and iceberg-flink-runtime 1.7.0+ for V3 support

aws-redshift:position-deletes:v2.notes: Redshift supports reading Iceberg tables with position deletes

aws-redshift:position-deletes:v3.notes: Redshift does not support Iceberg V3

aws-redshift:equality-deletes:v2.notes: Redshift supports reading Iceberg tables with equality deletes

aws-redshift:equality-deletes:v3.notes: Redshift does not support Iceberg V3

aws-redshift:merge-on-read:v2.notes: Redshift supports merge-on-read for Iceberg tables

aws-redshift:merge-on-read:v3.notes: Redshift does not support Iceberg V3

aws-redshift:copy-on-write:v2.notes: Redshift uses copy-on-write for Iceberg table writes

aws-redshift:copy-on-write:v3.notes: Redshift does not support Iceberg V3

aws-redshift:schema-evolution:v2.notes: Redshift supports schema evolution for Iceberg tables including add, drop, and rename columns

aws-redshift:schema-evolution:v3.notes: Redshift does not support Iceberg V3

aws-redshift:column-default-values:v2.notes: Column default values are a V3 feature

aws-redshift:column-default-values:v3.notes: Redshift does not support Iceberg V3

aws-redshift:table-creation:v2.notes: Redshift supports CREATE EXTERNAL TABLE for Iceberg tables in AWS Glue Data Catalog

aws-redshift:table-creation:v3.notes: Redshift does not support Iceberg V3

aws-redshift:hidden-partitioning:v2.notes: Redshift supports hidden partitioning for Iceberg tables

aws-redshift:hidden-partitioning:v3.notes: Redshift does not support Iceberg V3

aws-redshift:partition-evolution:v2.notes: Redshift can read partition-evolved tables but cannot perform partition evolution itself
caveats: Cannot modify partitioning; read-only support

aws-redshift:partition-evolution:v3.notes: Redshift does not support Iceberg V3

aws-redshift:multi-arg-transforms:v2.notes: Multi-argument transforms are a V3 feature

aws-redshift:multi-arg-transforms:v3.notes: Redshift does not support Iceberg V3

aws-redshift:time-travel:v2.notes: Redshift supports time travel queries on Iceberg tables by timestamp

aws-redshift:time-travel:v3.notes: Redshift does not support Iceberg V3

aws-redshift:table-maintenance:v2.notes: Redshift supports VACUUM for Iceberg tables including compaction and snapshot expiry
caveats: Limited to VACUUM operations

aws-redshift:table-maintenance:v3.notes: Redshift does not support Iceberg V3

aws-redshift:branching-tagging:v2.notes: Redshift does not support Iceberg branching and tagging

aws-redshift:branching-tagging:v3.notes: Redshift does not support Iceberg V3

aws-redshift:read-support:v2.notes: Full read support for Iceberg V1 and V2 tables via Redshift Spectrum, Redshift Serverless, and provisioned clusters. Supports external schemas and three-part notation with auto-mounted catalogs. Can join Iceberg tables with local Redshift tables. Supports materialized views on Iceberg tables.
caveats: Automatic query rewriting and automatic materialized views on Iceberg tables are not supported
COPY command cannot ingest from Iceberg tables; use INSERT INTO ... SELECT or CTAS
fixed(L) and uuid types not supported
Strings larger than 16384 chars are truncated

aws-redshift:read-support:v3.notes: Redshift does not support Iceberg V3

aws-redshift:write-insert:v2.notes: INSERT INTO supported for Iceberg tables on Redshift

aws-redshift:write-insert:v3.notes: Redshift does not support Iceberg V3

aws-redshift:write-merge-update-delete:v.notes: MERGE, UPDATE, DELETE supported for Iceberg tables on Redshift
Redshift does not support Iceberg V3

aws-redshift:catalog-integration:v2.notes: Integrated with AWS Glue Data Catalog

aws-redshift:catalog-integration:v3.notes: Redshift does not support Iceberg V3

aws-redshift:hive-metastore:v2.notes: Redshift uses AWS Glue Catalog for Iceberg tables

aws-redshift:hive-metastore:v3.notes: Redshift does not support Iceberg V3

aws-redshift:aws-glue-catalog:v2.notes: Native integration with AWS Glue Data Catalog for Iceberg tables

aws-redshift:aws-glue-catalog:v3.notes: Redshift does not support Iceberg V3

aws-redshift:rest-catalog:v2.notes: Redshift does not support REST Catalog directly

aws-redshift:rest-catalog:v3.notes: Redshift does not support Iceberg V3

aws-redshift:nessie:v2.notes: Redshift does not support Nessie catalog

aws-redshift:nessie:v3.notes: Redshift does not support Iceberg V3

aws-redshift:polaris:v2.notes: Redshift does not support Polaris catalog

aws-redshift:polaris:v3.notes: Redshift does not support Iceberg V3

aws-redshift:unity-catalog:v2.notes: Redshift does not support Unity Catalog

aws-redshift:unity-catalog:v3.notes: Redshift does not support Iceberg V3

aws-redshift:hadoop-catalog:v2.notes: Redshift does not support Hadoop catalog

aws-redshift:hadoop-catalog:v3.notes: Redshift does not support Iceberg V3

aws-redshift:jdbc-catalog:v2.notes: Redshift does not support JDBC catalog

aws-redshift:jdbc-catalog:v3.notes: Redshift does not support Iceberg V3

aws-redshift:variant-type:v2.notes: Variant type is a V3 feature

aws-redshift:variant-type:v3.notes: Redshift does not support Iceberg V3

aws-redshift:shredded-variant:v2.notes: Shredded variant is a V3 feature

aws-redshift:shredded-variant:v3.notes: Redshift does not support Iceberg V3

aws-redshift:geometry-type:v2.notes: Geometry types are a V3 feature

aws-redshift:geometry-type:v3.notes: Redshift does not support Iceberg V3

aws-redshift:vector-type:v2.notes: Vector type is a V3 feature

aws-redshift:vector-type:v3.notes: Redshift does not support Iceberg V3

aws-redshift:nanosecond-timestamps:v2.notes: Nanosecond timestamps are a V3 feature

aws-redshift:nanosecond-timestamps:v3.notes: Redshift does not support Iceberg V3

aws-redshift:cdc-support:v3.notes: Redshift does not support Iceberg V3

aws-redshift:lineage:v2.notes: Lineage tracking is a V3 feature

aws-redshift:lineage:v3.notes: Redshift does not support Iceberg V3

aws-athena:table-creation:v2.notes: Athena supports CREATE TABLE for Iceberg tables via CTAS and standard DDL
caveats: The set of table properties that you can declared is limited.

aws-athena:table-creation:v3.notes: Athena does not support Iceberg V3

aws-firehose:table-creation:v2.notes: Firehose cannot create Iceberg tables; the table must already exist

aws-firehose:table-creation:v3.notes: Firehose does not support Iceberg V3

aws-managed-flink:table-creation:v2.notes: Flink Iceberg connector supports CREATE TABLE via Flink SQL DDL; partitioning limited to identity transforms only
caveats: Iceberg is not a pre-built connector; users must bundle iceberg-flink-runtime JAR
PARTITION BY does not support transform functions (days, hours, bucket, truncate)

aws-managed-flink:table-creation:v3.notes: V3 table creation supported via Flink SQL DDL with 'format-version'='3' table property when bundling iceberg-flink-runtime 1.7.0+
caveats: Iceberg is not a pre-built connector; users must bundle iceberg-flink-runtime JAR (1.7.0+) for V3 support
PARTITION BY does not support transform functions (days, hours, bucket, truncate)

aws-athena:variant-type:v2.notes: Variant Type is a V3 feature

aws-athena:variant-type:v3.notes: Athena does not support Iceberg V3

aws-athena:shredded-variant:v2.notes: Shredded Variant is a V3 feature

aws-athena:shredded-variant:v3.notes: Athena does not support Iceberg V3

aws-athena:geometry-type:v2.notes: Geometry Type is a V3 feature

aws-athena:geometry-type:v3.notes: Athena does not support Iceberg V3

aws-athena:vector-type:v2.notes: Vector Type is a V3 feature

aws-athena:vector-type:v3.notes: Athena does not support Iceberg V3

aws-athena:cdc-support:v2.notes: Cdc Support is a V3 feature

aws-athena:cdc-support:v3.notes: Athena does not support Iceberg V3

aws-athena:lineage:v3.notes: Athena does not support Iceberg V3

aws-firehose:variant-type:v2.notes: Variant Type is a V3 feature

aws-firehose:variant-type:v3.notes: Firehose does not support Iceberg V3

aws-firehose:shredded-variant:v2.notes: Shredded Variant is a V3 feature

aws-firehose:shredded-variant:v3.notes: Firehose does not support Iceberg V3

aws-firehose:geometry-type:v2.notes: Geometry Type is a V3 feature

aws-firehose:geometry-type:v3.notes: Firehose does not support Iceberg V3

aws-firehose:vector-type:v2.notes: Vector Type is a V3 feature

aws-firehose:vector-type:v3.notes: Firehose does not support Iceberg V3

aws-firehose:cdc-support:v2.notes: Cdc Support is a V3 feature

aws-firehose:cdc-support:v3.notes: Firehose does not support Iceberg V3

aws-firehose:lineage:v3.notes: Firehose does not support Iceberg V3

aws-managed-flink:variant-type:v2.notes: Variant type is a V3 feature; not applicable to V2 tables

aws-managed-flink:variant-type:v3.notes: Variant type is a V3 feature; Flink Iceberg integration has not explicitly documented support for the variant type
caveats: No explicit documentation for Flink support of V3 variant type

aws-managed-flink:shredded-variant:v2.notes: Shredded variant is a V3 feature; not applicable to V2 tables

aws-managed-flink:shredded-variant:v3.notes: Shredded variant is a V3 feature; Flink Iceberg integration has not explicitly documented support
caveats: No explicit documentation for Flink support of V3 shredded variant

aws-managed-flink:geometry-type:v2.notes: Geometry type is a V3 feature; not applicable to V2 tables

aws-managed-flink:geometry-type:v3.notes: Geometry type is a V3 feature; Flink Iceberg integration has not explicitly documented support
caveats: No explicit documentation for Flink support of V3 geometry type

aws-managed-flink:vector-type:v2.notes: Vector type is a V3 feature; not applicable to V2 tables

aws-managed-flink:vector-type:v3.notes: Vector type is a V3 feature; Flink Iceberg integration has not explicitly documented support
caveats: No explicit documentation for Flink support of V3 vector type

aws-managed-flink:cdc-support:v2.notes: Flink Iceberg connector supports CDC via UPSERT mode with equality deletes on V2 tables; requires primary key and write.upsert.enabled=true
caveats: Requires V2 format and PRIMARY KEY defined on the table
Iceberg is not a pre-built connector; users must bundle iceberg-flink-runtime JAR

aws-managed-flink:cdc-support:v3.notes: CDC via UPSERT mode supported on V3 tables with deletion vectors when bundling iceberg-flink-runtime 1.7.0+
caveats: Requires PRIMARY KEY defined on the table
Iceberg is not a pre-built connector; users must bundle iceberg-flink-runtime JAR (1.7.0+) for V3 support

aws-managed-flink:lineage:v2.notes: Row lineage is a V3 feature; not applicable to V2 tables

aws-managed-flink:lineage:v3.notes: Row lineage is a V3 feature introduced with deletion vectors; Flink Iceberg integration has not explicitly documented support for querying row lineage metadata fields
caveats: No explicit documentation for Flink support of V3 row lineage metadata fields (_row_id, _last_updated_sequence_number)

aws-athena:statistics:v2.notes: Athena writes column statistics to Iceberg manifest files on INSERT/CTAS and uses them for scan planning and file pruning. Athena also supports computing Iceberg table statistics for cost-based optimization.

aws-athena:statistics:v3.notes: Athena does not support Iceberg V3

aws-athena:bloom-filters:v2.notes: Bloom filters are supported in Trino (trinodb/trino#21602) but further testing is needed to confirm Athena support
caveats: Needs further testing to confirm support

aws-athena:bloom-filters:v3.notes: Athena does not support Iceberg V3

aws-firehose:statistics:v2.notes: Firehose writes basic column statistics to Iceberg manifest files when delivering data to Iceberg tables. Statistics are written automatically as part of the standard Iceberg write path.
caveats: Limited configuration options for statistics compared to Spark
Firehose is a write-only delivery service

aws-firehose:statistics:v3.notes: Firehose does not support Iceberg V3

aws-firehose:bloom-filters:v2.notes: Firehose does not support configuring Parquet-level bloom filters or Puffin-based bloom filter statistics for Iceberg tables.

aws-firehose:bloom-filters:v3.notes: Firehose does not support Iceberg V3

aws-managed-flink:statistics:v2.notes: Flink Iceberg connector writes column statistics to manifest files by default via the standard Iceberg write path. Uses statistics for scan planning during reads.
caveats: Iceberg is not a pre-built connector; users must bundle iceberg-flink-runtime JAR

aws-managed-flink:statistics:v3.notes: Column statistics supported for V3 tables when bundling iceberg-flink-runtime 1.7.0+
caveats: Iceberg is not a pre-built connector; users must bundle iceberg-flink-runtime JAR (1.7.0+) for V3 support

aws-managed-flink:bloom-filters:v2.notes: Bloom filter support requires further testing to confirm
caveats: Needs further testing to confirm support

aws-managed-flink:bloom-filters:v3.notes: Bloom filter support requires further testing to confirm
caveats: Needs further testing to confirm support

aws-redshift:statistics:v2.notes: Redshift reads column statistics from Iceberg manifest files for scan planning and file pruning. Writes column statistics when performing DML operations on Iceberg tables.

aws-redshift:statistics:v3.notes: Redshift does not support Iceberg V3

aws-redshift:bloom-filters:v2.notes: Redshift does not support Iceberg Parquet-level bloom filters or Puffin-based bloom filter statistics.

aws-redshift:bloom-filters:v3.notes: Redshift does not support Iceberg V3

aws-athena:type-promotion:v2.notes: Type promotion may be supported but further testing is needed to confirm behavior
caveats: Needs further testing to confirm support

aws-athena:type-promotion:v3.notes: Athena does not support Iceberg V3

aws-firehose:type-promotion:v2.notes: Firehose is an ingestion service and does not support DDL operations like type promotion. Schema evolution in Firehose is limited to adding new columns from source schema changes.
caveats: Firehose cannot perform ALTER TABLE or type change operations
Type promotions must be performed externally using Athena, Spark, or another DDL-capable engine

aws-firehose:type-promotion:v3.notes: Firehose does not support Iceberg V3

aws-managed-flink:type-promotion:v2.notes: Flink supports type widening for Iceberg tables

aws-managed-flink:type-promotion:v3.notes: Flink supports type widening for Iceberg V3 tables

aws-redshift:type-promotion:v2.notes: Redshift supports ALTER TABLE for Iceberg schema evolution including type changes. Supports reading tables with promoted types. Limited to the Iceberg spec-defined promotions.
caveats: Type promotion support depends on the Iceberg table being managed via AWS Glue Catalog

aws-redshift:type-promotion:v3.notes: Redshift does not support Iceberg V3

aws-emr-glue:position-deletes:v2.notes: Supported via Spark on Glue 3.0+ (Iceberg 0.13.1+); Glue 4.0+ (Iceberg 1.0.0) recommended for production
caveats: Glue 3.0 (Iceberg 0.13.1) requires DynamoDB lock manager for atomic transactions

aws-emr-glue:position-deletes:v3.notes: V3 replaces positional deletes with deletion vectors (Puffin files); requires Glue 5.0+ (Iceberg 1.7.1+), Glue 5.1 (Iceberg 1.10.0) recommended
caveats: Requires Glue 5.0+ for V3 format support
Glue 5.1 (Iceberg 1.10.0) recommended for full deletion vector support

aws-emr-glue:equality-deletes:v2.notes: Supported via Spark on Glue 3.0+; Glue 4.0+ recommended

aws-emr-glue:equality-deletes:v3.notes: V3 replaces equality deletes with deletion vectors; requires Glue 5.0+, Glue 5.1 recommended
caveats: Requires Glue 5.0+ for V3 format support
V3 deletion vectors supersede V2 equality delete files

aws-emr-glue:merge-on-read:v2.notes: Merge-on-read supported via Spark on Glue 3.0+

aws-emr-glue:merge-on-read:v3.notes: Merge-on-read with V3 deletion vectors; requires Glue 5.0+, Glue 5.1 recommended for best performance
caveats: Requires Glue 5.0+ for V3 format support

aws-emr-glue:copy-on-write:v2.notes: Copy-on-write supported via Spark on Glue 3.0+

aws-emr-glue:copy-on-write:v3.notes: Copy-on-write supported via Spark on Glue 5.0+
caveats: Requires Glue 5.0+ for V3 format support

aws-emr-glue:schema-evolution:v2.notes: Full schema evolution (add, drop, rename, reorder columns) via Spark SQL on Glue 3.0+; ALTER TABLE RENAME not available on Glue 3.0
caveats: ALTER TABLE ... RENAME TO not available on Glue 3.0 (Iceberg 0.13.1)

aws-emr-glue:schema-evolution:v3.notes: Full schema evolution supported via Spark on Glue 5.0+
caveats: Requires Glue 5.0+ for V3 format support

aws-emr-glue:column-default-values:v2.notes: Column default values are a V3 feature, not available in format version 2

aws-emr-glue:column-default-values:v3.notes: Supported via Spark on Glue 5.0+ (Iceberg 1.7.1+); requires format-version=3
caveats: Requires Glue 5.0+ with V3 format tables

aws-emr-glue:nanosecond-timestamps:v2.notes: Nanosecond timestamps are a V3 feature, not available in format version 2

aws-emr-glue:nanosecond-timestamps:v3.notes: Supported via Spark on Glue 5.0+ (Iceberg 1.7.1+); requires format-version=3
caveats: Requires Glue 5.0+ with V3 format tables

aws-emr-glue:hidden-partitioning:v2.notes: Supports identity, bucket, truncate, year, month, day, hour partition transforms via Spark on Glue 3.0+

aws-emr-glue:hidden-partitioning:v3.notes: Full hidden partitioning supported via Spark on Glue 5.0+
caveats: Requires Glue 5.0+ for V3 format support

aws-emr-glue:partition-evolution:v2.notes: Partition evolution supported via Spark SQL ALTER TABLE on Glue 3.0+

aws-emr-glue:partition-evolution:v3.notes: Partition evolution supported via Spark on Glue 5.0+
caveats: Requires Glue 5.0+ for V3 format support

aws-emr-glue:multi-arg-transforms:v2.notes: Multi-argument transforms are a V3 feature, not available in format version 2

aws-emr-glue:multi-arg-transforms:v3.notes: Supported via Spark on Glue 5.0+ (Iceberg 1.7.1+); requires format-version=3
caveats: Requires Glue 5.0+ with V3 format tables

aws-emr-glue:time-travel:v2.notes: Query by snapshot ID or timestamp via Spark SQL on Glue 3.0+

aws-emr-glue:time-travel:v3.notes: Time travel supported via Spark on Glue 5.0+; spans V2 and V3 snapshots after upgrade
caveats: Requires Glue 5.0+ for V3 format support

aws-emr-glue:table-maintenance:v2.notes: Spark procedures (rewrite_data_files, expire_snapshots, remove_orphan_files) available on Glue 4.0+; AWS Glue Data Catalog provides automatic compaction, snapshot expiry, and orphan file removal
caveats: Glue 3.0 (Iceberg 0.13.1) has limited maintenance procedures
Automatic optimization requires Glue Data Catalog configuration

links.label: Working with Iceberg in AWS Glue (prescriptive guidance)

aws-emr-glue:table-maintenance:v3.notes: Full table maintenance for V3 tables; automatic optimization via Glue Data Catalog compacts deletion vector files and removes old V2 delete files after upgrade
caveats: Requires Glue 5.0+ for V3 format support
First compaction after V2→V3 upgrade removes old positional/equality delete files

aws-emr-glue:branching-tagging:v2.notes: Supported via Spark on EMR. Glue: Branching and tagging require Iceberg ≥1.2.0; only available natively on Glue 5.0+ (Iceberg 1.7.1) or via custom JARs on Glue 4.0
caveats: Not available on Glue 3.0 or Glue 4.0 with native Iceberg (0.13.1 / 1.0.0)
Requires Glue 5.0+ or custom Iceberg JARs ≥1.2.0

aws-emr-glue:branching-tagging:v3.notes: Supported via Spark on EMR. Glue: Branching and tagging supported on Glue 5.0+ (Iceberg 1.7.1+) with V3 tables
caveats: Requires Glue 5.0+ for V3 format support

aws-emr-glue:read-support:v2.notes: Full read support via Spark on Glue 3.0+; supports GlueContext DynamicFrame and Spark DataFrame APIs

aws-emr-glue:read-support:v3.notes: Full read support for V3 tables on Glue 5.0+; handles deletion vectors transparently
caveats: Requires Glue 5.0+ for V3 format support

aws-emr-glue:write-insert:v2.notes: INSERT INTO, CTAS, and DataFrame append supported via Spark and GlueContext APIs on Glue 3.0+

aws-emr-glue:write-insert:v3.notes: INSERT INTO supported on Glue 5.0+ with V3 format tables
caveats: Requires Glue 5.0+ for V3 format support

aws-emr-glue:write-merge-update-delete:v.notes: MERGE, UPDATE, DELETE supported via Spark SQL with IcebergSparkSessionExtensions on Glue 3.0+; GlueContext native API supports append/overwrite only
caveats: Requires IcebergSparkSessionExtensions for UPDATE/DELETE/MERGE
GlueContext write_data_frame API limited to append and overwrite modes

aws-emr-glue:write-merge-update-delete:v.notes: MERGE, UPDATE, DELETE supported via Spark SQL on Glue 5.0+; V3 deletion vectors improve write performance for updates and deletes
caveats: Requires Glue 5.0+ for V3 format support
Requires IcebergSparkSessionExtensions for UPDATE/DELETE/MERGE

aws-emr-glue:catalog-integration:v2.notes: Native AWS Glue Data Catalog integration as Iceberg catalog; also supports Iceberg REST Catalog API

links.label: Working with Iceberg in AWS Glue (prescriptive guidance)

aws-emr-glue:catalog-integration:v3.notes: Native AWS Glue Data Catalog integration with V3 support; Iceberg REST Catalog API supported
caveats: Requires Glue 5.0+ for V3 format support

aws-emr-glue:hive-metastore:v2.notes: Native Hive Metastore support on EMR. Glue: Can connect to external Hive Metastore via custom Spark catalog configuration; Glue Data Catalog is the default and recommended catalog
caveats: Requires custom Spark configuration
Not the default catalog; Glue Data Catalog is preferred

aws-emr-glue:hive-metastore:v3.notes: Native Hive Metastore support on EMR. Glue: Can connect to external Hive Metastore via custom Spark configuration on Glue 5.0+
caveats: Requires custom Spark configuration
Not the default catalog; Glue Data Catalog is preferred

aws-emr-glue:aws-glue-catalog:v2.notes: Native default catalog for AWS Glue; pre-configured as glue_catalog with GlueCatalog implementation

links.label: Working with Iceberg in AWS Glue (prescriptive guidance)

aws-emr-glue:aws-glue-catalog:v3.notes: Native default catalog for AWS Glue with V3 table support; automatic table optimization available
caveats: Requires Glue 5.0+ for V3 format support

aws-emr-glue:rest-catalog:v2.notes: AWS Glue Data Catalog supports the Iceberg REST Catalog API, enabling cross-engine interoperability

aws-emr-glue:rest-catalog:v3.notes: AWS Glue Data Catalog REST Catalog API supports V3 tables

aws-emr-glue:nessie:v2.notes: Nessie catalog supported via Spark on EMR. Glue: Can connect to Nessie via custom Spark catalog configuration on Glue; not natively integrated
caveats: Requires custom Spark configuration and Nessie endpoint
Nessie JARs must be provided via --extra-jars

aws-emr-glue:nessie:v3.notes: Nessie catalog supported via Spark on EMR. Glue: Can connect to Nessie via custom Spark configuration on Glue 5.0+
caveats: Requires custom Spark configuration, Nessie endpoint, and extra JARs

aws-emr-glue:polaris:v2.notes: Polaris supported via REST Catalog on EMR. Glue: Can connect to Polaris via REST Catalog configuration on Glue
caveats: Requires custom Spark REST Catalog configuration

aws-emr-glue:polaris:v3.notes: Polaris supported via REST Catalog on EMR. Glue: Can connect to Polaris via REST Catalog configuration on Glue 5.0+
caveats: Requires custom Spark REST Catalog configuration

aws-emr-glue:unity-catalog:v2.notes: Can connect to Unity Catalog via REST Catalog API on EMR. Glue: AWS Glue does not natively support Databricks Unity Catalog
caveats: Requires Databricks REST Catalog endpoint configuration

aws-emr-glue:unity-catalog:v3.notes: Can connect to Unity Catalog via REST Catalog API on EMR. Glue: AWS Glue does not natively support Databricks Unity Catalog
caveats: Requires Databricks REST Catalog endpoint configuration

aws-emr-glue:hadoop-catalog:v2.notes: Hadoop catalog supported via Spark on EMR. Glue: Can use Hadoop catalog via custom Spark configuration on Glue; not recommended for production
caveats: Requires custom Spark configuration
No atomic rename guarantee on S3; Glue Data Catalog recommended instead

aws-emr-glue:hadoop-catalog:v3.notes: Hadoop catalog supported via Spark on EMR. Glue: Can use Hadoop catalog via custom Spark configuration on Glue 5.0+; not recommended
caveats: Requires custom Spark configuration
No atomic rename guarantee on S3; Glue Data Catalog recommended instead

aws-emr-glue:jdbc-catalog:v2.notes: JDBC catalog supported via Spark on EMR. Glue: Can use JDBC catalog via custom Spark configuration on Glue
caveats: Requires custom Spark configuration, JDBC driver, and endpoint

aws-emr-glue:jdbc-catalog:v3.notes: JDBC catalog supported via Spark on EMR. Glue: Can use JDBC catalog via custom Spark configuration on Glue 5.0+
caveats: Requires custom Spark configuration, JDBC driver, and endpoint

aws-emr-glue:table-creation:v2.notes: Create Iceberg tables via Spark SQL DDL (CREATE TABLE, CTAS) or Glue Data Catalog CreateTable API on Glue 3.0+
caveats: Glue Data Catalog UpdateTable API does not support Iceberg table format as input

aws-emr-glue:table-creation:v3.notes: Create V3 tables via Spark SQL DDL with format-version=3 on Glue 5.0+; upgrade V2→V3 via ALTER TABLE SET TBLPROPERTIES
caveats: Requires Glue 5.0+ for V3 format support
V2→V3 upgrade is one-way; cannot downgrade back to V2

aws-emr-glue:variant-type:v2.notes: Variant type is a V3 feature, not available in format version 2

aws-emr-glue:variant-type:v3.notes: Variant type supported via Spark on AWS EMR with Iceberg V3. Glue: Variant type introduced in Iceberg V3; basic support available on Glue 5.1 (Iceberg 1.10.0) but the spec is still evolving
caveats: Requires Glue 5.1 (Iceberg 1.10.0)
Variant type support is still maturing in the Iceberg ecosystem

aws-emr-glue:shredded-variant:v2.notes: Shredded variant is a V3 feature, not available in format version 2

aws-emr-glue:shredded-variant:v3.notes: Shredded variant support in AWS Glue is not yet documented; depends on Iceberg library support
caveats: Not yet documented for AWS Glue

aws-emr-glue:geometry-type:v2.notes: Geometry type is a V3 feature, not available in format version 2

aws-emr-glue:geometry-type:v3.notes: Geometry type support in AWS Glue is not yet documented
caveats: Not yet documented for AWS Glue

aws-emr-glue:vector-type:v2.notes: Vector type is a V3 feature, not available in format version 2

aws-emr-glue:vector-type:v3.notes: Vector type support in AWS Glue is not yet documented
caveats: Not yet documented for AWS Glue

aws-emr-glue:cdc-support:v2.notes: Row-level CDC tracking is a V3 feature (row lineage); not available in format version 2

aws-emr-glue:cdc-support:v3.notes: V3 row lineage enables row-level change tracking via _row_id and _last_updated_sequence_number fields; requires Glue 5.1 (Iceberg 1.10.0) for full support. EMR: CDC support available via Spark streaming on AWS EMR
caveats: Requires Glue 5.1 (Iceberg 1.10.0) for row lineage
No historical backfill of row lineage after V2→V3 upgrade
Requires streaming configuration

aws-emr-glue:lineage:v2.notes: Row lineage is a V3 feature, not available in format version 2

aws-emr-glue:lineage:v3.notes: V3 row lineage provides _row_id and _last_updated_sequence_number metadata fields for precise change tracking; requires Glue 5.1 (Iceberg 1.10.0). EMR: AWS EMR V3 lineage support is not yet documented
caveats: Requires Glue 5.1 (Iceberg 1.10.0)
No historical backfill after V2→V3 upgrade

aws-emr-glue:statistics:v2.notes: AWS Glue writes column statistics to Iceberg manifest files via Spark on Glue 3.0+. Statistics include min/max values, null counts, and value counts. Configurable via write.metadata.metrics.default and per-column settings.

aws-emr-glue:statistics:v3.notes: Column statistics fully supported via Spark on Glue 5.0+ for V3 tables
caveats: Requires Glue 5.0+ for V3 format support

aws-emr-glue:bloom-filters:v2.notes: Full bloom filter support via Spark on EMR. Parquet-level bloom filters configurable via write.parquet.bloom-filter-enabled.column.* table properties. Also supports compute_table_stats procedure for Puffin-based statistics.. Glue: Parquet-level bloom filters can be enabled via Iceberg table properties (write.parquet.bloom-filter-enabled.column.*) when writing with Spark on Glue 4.0+. Not enabled by default.
caveats: Requires setting bloom filter table properties per column
Not enabled by default
No Puffin-based bloom filter support

aws-emr-glue:bloom-filters:v3.notes: Full bloom filter support via Spark on EMR with Iceberg V3. Glue: Parquet-level bloom filters supported via Iceberg table properties on Glue 5.0+ for V3 tables
caveats: Requires setting bloom filter table properties per column
Requires Glue 5.0+ for V3 format support

aws-emr-glue:type-promotion:v2.notes: AWS Glue supports type promotion via Spark SQL ALTER TABLE ALTER COLUMN TYPE on Iceberg tables. Supports int to bigint, float to double, and decimal precision widening.
caveats: Requires Spark SQL within Glue ETL jobs
Metadata-only operation; no data file rewrite required

aws-emr-glue:type-promotion:v3.notes: Type promotion supported via Spark SQL on Glue 5.0+ for V3 Iceberg tables.
